results.title: Wills and Burke: The Untold Story
results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Margot McDonald and Stony Desert
results.brief_description: Comic recreation of explorers Burke & Wills and their ill-fated expedition to cross Australia in 1860. Setting out with 28 camels and 4 camel drivers, they were two-thirds through the journey when the expedition was completely without food and almost out of tea. Public enthusiasm remained high for Burke & Wills and the expedition from which they did not return. Starring Gary McDonald and Kim Gyngell.

results.title: Willow
results.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Nigel Wooll and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
results.brief_description: Enter the enchanting world of Willow. An epic tale of pure adventure that takes us deep into the world of sorcery and scary monsters, hope and heroism. Willow Ufgood (Warwick Davis) is a small Nelwyn farmer with big dreams to be a sorcerer. His chance arrives when he is made guardian of a baby girl, Elora Danan, who is destined to fulfill a prophecy and bring down the evil sorceress Queen Bavmarda (Jean Marsh) and her daughter Sorsha (Joanne Whalley) . It is Willow’s task to keep the child safely out of the reach of the evil Queen, and so begins an incredible journey of fierce battles, near misses, danger and romance. Aided by Madmartigan (Val Kilmer), Willow matches wits and strength with the forces of evil for the life of a child whose destiny could change the world. This is a lavish film jam-packed with special effects by the Industrial Light and Magic team, and will delight children of all age with its heartwarming message of the love of a parent protecting their child from the dangers of the world.

results.title: Willoughby's magic hat
results.brief_description: An animated recreation of the historic events that occured to Samson’s hair after it was cut by Delilah. This comic film claims that Delilah knitted a cap out of Samson’s hair and gave it to her other boyfriend Hercules. Since then, the cap has journeyed through history bestowing strength and courage on new owners. This century, the cap was purchased by a meek and mild character called Willoughby who used the cap’s magical powers to fight crime and evil on the street’s of his city. We see Willoughby bravely saving a damsel in distress, climaxing with her rescue from the path of oncoming trains.

results.title: Willingly to school (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This film looks at some of the changes that British schools are making towards emphasising not the ability to memorise facts but the quality of thought itself. It shows the educational implications of Professor Jean Piaget’s work - especially the need to gear teaching to the child’s learning processes.

results.title: Willie Nelson and Family in concert
results.brief_description: Filmed at the Austin Opry House in Texas in 1983, Willie Nelson performs some of his classic greats including “On the road again”, “Always on my mind”, “Stardust” and “Georgia”. With his Family, Willie presents music that is country, that is rock, that is jazz, with the wonderful enthusiasm and exuberance this American performer is known and loved for. Features Jackie King as special guest and includes documentary footage of Willie, his family and his band at the beginning of the video. Members of the band include Bobbie Nelson (piano), Bee Spears (bass), Mickey Raphael (harmonica), Grady Martin (guitar), Jody Payne (guitar), Paul English (drums).

results.title: William Shakespeare, background for his works
results.brief_description: Shows the places of Shakespeare’s times and the elements of his English life that gave the poet-playwright his language and shaped his character. Kenilworth Castle, Stratford, the River Avon, the Anne Hathaway cottage and a model of the original Globe Theatre are portrayed. Brief episodes are presented from some of the plays of Shakespeare: “Romeo and Juliet”, “Macbeth”, “Taming of the Shrew”, “The Merchant of Venice”, and “Hamlet”.
